In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

The development of a country will be assessed by three basic needs Education, Shelter and Medical facilites availabe to the common people.Of these, health care supply is most essential. But here, the questin arises that "does it possible to provide these basic needs specially health care supply" to our country which is 2nd highest populated country in the world with approximately 121 crore people according to the 2011 census.

In India, there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. India is a very diversified country with different cultural people. India, with 28 states and 7 union territories  has a unique status. Each state has its own culture, language  social conditions and ethical values. The environment affects the life of people a lot. The Govt. shold make a policy & regulate strictly preserving the forest areas and environment. it should contain atleast 33% of land under forest deportment. The schedule trible people mostly depend on these areas to lead their life. The increase in population, causing for deforestation. they are cutting trees and using it for agricultural purpose. It causes for many environmental distrubances. The 60% of people of India are living in villages. where people are not accessable to techonology and medical facilities.

Though, the Governament is very much concern about health of people and making policies, but they are not reaching the poor and needed people. Many of the villages dont have transport facilites, hospitals, a few with lack of human resources.The advanced techonogical methods shoud be introduced and Strategic planning should be made. In remote areas it is possible to establish many hospitals under publlic private partnership. The mobile hospital may help to resolve this issue. Many of the people are living under poverty, they are uneducated and beliving in superstitions not going to hospitals.The people are not aware of many diseases. They must be educated and conduct awareness programs.

Providing helath care facilities is the responsibility of any elected Governament. It is the right of every Indian.
